LA.chat.tooltip: Send a card representing this item to the chat
LA.activate.label: ACTIVATE
LA.activate.tooltip: The amount of activations this character has per round
LA.trigger.label: TRIGGER
LA.limited.label: USES
LA.limited.tooltip: Consume a limited use of this weapon/system
LA.loaded.label: LOADED
LA.loaded.tooltip: The loaded state of this weapon/system
LA.armor.tooltip:
Armor reduces all incoming damage to HP from a single source by an amount equal to its rating, unless stated otherwise (such as Burn and AP)

Armor can reduce damage to 0, has a limit of 4, and resolves after the Exposed status and before Resistance
LA.edefense.tooltip: E-Defense determines the threshold needed to hit a target with a Tech Attack and other electronically guided systems (such as Seeking)
LA.evasion.tooltip: Evasion determines the threshold needed to hit a target with a ranged or melee attack
LA.tattack.tooltip: Tech Attack is used in place of Grit when making a Tech Attack or conducting electronic warfare
LA.sensor.tooltip:
Sensors is the maximum distance from the edge of a character's space that they can detect enemies, make tech attacks, and use electronic systems

They are aware of all other characters within their sensor range so long as those characters are not hiding, even if there is no direct line-of-sight
LA.save.tooltip: Save Target determines the threshold needed to resist an effect being caused by this character when it forces another character to make a save
LA.hitpoint.tooltip:
Hit Points are the amount of damage the current Structure threshold can resist before being destroyed

Any excess damage carries over to the next Structure threshold
LA.overshield.tooltip:
Overshields provide Hit Points that disappears at the end of the scene or as determined by the source. A character can only have a single instance of Overshield, retaining the highest value

When damage is received, Overshield is reduced before HP when it is active and resolves the same way as HP
LA.structure.label: STRUCT
LA.structure.tooltip: Structure is the amount of damage a character can take before being destroyed. When their HP is reduced to 0, they take Structure damage and roll the Structure Damage Table
LA.heat.label: HEAT
LA.heat.tooltip:
Heat is the amount of thermal strain the current Stress threshold can resist before overheating. Heat ignores Armor but can be resisted

Any excess heat carries over to the next Stress threshold. Biological characters take energy damage in place of heat
LA.stress.label: STRESS
LA.stress.tooltip: Stress is the amount of heat a character can take before their internals undergo meltdown. When a character exceeds their heat capacity, they roll the Overheating Table
LA.burn.label: BURN
LA.burn.tooltip:
Burn is a special damage that ignores armor but can be resisted

Characters that receive Burn damage must take the amount received and add it to their current Burn value. At the end of their turn characters roll an Engineering check to clear the accumulated Burn, or take the accumulated Burn as damage

LA.speed.tooltip: The amount of space this character can cover on a standard move or when they Boost
LA.size.tooltip: The effective size of this character including their area of control

LA.flow.tooltip: Run the assigned macro or flow
LA.flow.stabilize.label: STABILIZE
LA.flow.stabilize.tooltip:
Clear all heat and Exposed or consume a Repair to fully restore current HP

Additionally choose between: clearing an externally inflicted condition from self or an adjacent ally, clearing burn from self, or reloading all Loading weapons
LA.flow.overcharge.label: OVERCHARGE
LA.flow.overcharge.tooltip: Make an extra quick action for the cost of {0} heat

LA.flow.structureDamage.label: EVALUATE

LA.flow.extinguish.tooltip: Pass an engineering check to extinguish the burn otherwise receive the accumulated number as armor ignoring damage

LA.flow.fullRepair.tooltip: Repair all structure and stress damage

LA.effect.attack.label: ON ATTACK
LA.effect.hit.label: ON HIT
LA.effect.crit.label: ON CRITICAL
LA.action.full.label: FULL ACTION
LA.action.full.tooltip: Full actions can be used to make an improvised attack, skill check, barrage, full tech, disengage, stabilize, boot up, mount/dismount, or activate an appropriate system
LA.action.quick.label: QUICK ACTION
LA.action.quick.tooltip: Quick actions can be used to boost, skirmish, grapple, ram, quick tech, hide, search, eject, prepare, shut down, self-destruct, or activate an appropriate system
LA.action.reaction.label: REACTION
LA.action.reaction.tooltip: Reactions can be made outside of the turn order as a response to a trigger and a character can only take one reaction per turn, up to any amount per round
LA.action.free.label: FREE ACTION
LA.action.free.tooltip: Free actions can be used at any time during a turn and can be used to take an action more than once per turn
LA.action.protocol.label: PROTOCOL
LA.action.protocol.tooltip: Protocols are free actions that must be activated at the beginning of the turn
LA.action.invade.label: INVADE
LA.action.invade.tooltip: Invasions are tech attacks against a character within sensors and line-of-sight that inflict 2 Heat and the effects of an invasion option available to this character. Allied and willing targets are automatically invaded, do not take heat, and are not considered attacked
LA.action.quickTech.label: QUICK TECH
LA.action.quickTech.tooltip: Quick techs can be used to bolster, scan, lock on, or invade with Fragment Signal or another invasion option
LA.action.fullTech.label: FULL TECH
LA.action.fullTech.tooltip: Full techs can be used to make two quick techs or activate another system that require a full tech to activate
LA.action.overcharge.label: OVERCHARGE
LA.action.move.label: MOVE
LA.action.endofturn.label: END OF TURN
LA.action.startofturn.label: START OF TURN

LA.npc.accuracy.tooltip: The innate Accuracy bonus of this weapon
